member.summary: Constructor. Use this in platform specific application projects.

member.summary: Devices supported by this driver: One mouse and one keyboard.

member.summary: Returns a human readable description of this driver.

member.summary: Returns a (hopefully) unique ID for this driver. Uniqueness is granted by using the full class name (including namespace).

member.name: E:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.RenderCanvasInputDriverImp.DeviceDisconnected
member.summary: Not supported on this driver. Mouse and keyboard are considered to be connected all the time. You can register handlers but they will never get called.

member.name: E:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.RenderCanvasInputDriverImp.NewDeviceConnected
member.summary: Not supported on this driver. Mouse and keyboard are considered to be connected all the time. You can register handlers but they will never get called.

member.name: T:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.KeyboardDeviceImp
member.summary: Keyboard input device implementation for the WebAsm platform.

member.summary: Should be called by the driver only.

member.name: P:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.KeyboardDeviceImp.AxesCount
member.summary: Returns the number of Axes (==0, keyboard does not support any axes).

member.name: P:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.KeyboardDeviceImp.AxisImpDesc
member.summary: Empty enumeration for keyboard, since is 0.

member.name: P:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.KeyboardDeviceImp.ButtonCount
member.summary: Returns the number of enum values of

member.name: P:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.KeyboardDeviceImp.ButtonImpDesc
member.summary: Returns a description for each keyboard button.

member.name: P:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.KeyboardDeviceImp.Category
member.summary: This is a keyboard device, so this property returns .

member.name: P:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.KeyboardDeviceImp.Desc
member.summary: Human readable description of this device (to be used in dialogs).

member.name: P:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.KeyboardDeviceImp.Id
member.summary: Returns a (hopefully) unique ID for this driver. Uniqueness is granted by using the full class name (including name space).

member.name: E:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.KeyboardDeviceImp.AxisValueChanged
member.summary: No axes exist on this device, so listeners registered to this event will never get called.

member.name: E:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.KeyboardDeviceImp.ButtonValueChanged
member.summary: All buttons exhibited by this device are event-driven buttons, so this is the point to hook to in order to get information from this device.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.KeyboardDeviceImp.GetAxis(System.Int32)
member.summary: This device does not support any axes at all. Always throws.
member.param: No matter what you specify here, you'll evoke an exception.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.KeyboardDeviceImp.GetButton(System.Int32)
member.summary: This device does not support to-be-polled-buttons. All keyboard buttons are event-driven. Listen to the event to receive keyboard notifications from this device.
member.param: No matter what you specify here, you'll evoke an exception.

member.name: T:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.MouseDeviceImp
member.summary: Mouse input device implementation for the Web platforms.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.MouseDeviceImp.#ctor(WebAssembly.JSObject)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.MouseDeviceImp.AxesCount
member.summary: Number of axes. Here seven: "X", "Y" and "Wheel" as well as MinX, MaxX, MinY and MaxY

member.name: P:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.MouseDeviceImp.AxisImpDesc
member.summary: Returns description information for all axes.

member.name: P:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.MouseDeviceImp.ButtonCount
member.summary: Number of buttons exposed by this device. Here three: Left, Middle and Right mouse buttons.

member.name: P:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.MouseDeviceImp.ButtonImpDesc
member.summary: A mouse exposes three buttons: left, middle and right.

member.name: P:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.MouseDeviceImp.Category
member.summary: Returns , just because it's a mouse.

member.name: P:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.MouseDeviceImp.Desc
member.summary: Short description string for this device to be used in dialogs.

member.name: P:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.MouseDeviceImp.Id
member.summary: Returns a (hopefully) unique ID for this driver. Uniqueness is granted by using the full class name (including name space).

member.name: E:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.MouseDeviceImp.AxisValueChanged
member.summary: This exposes mouseX and mouseY as event-based axes, while the mouseWheel is to be polled.

member.name: E:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.MouseDeviceImp.ButtonValueChanged
member.summary: All three mouse buttons are event-based. Listen to this event to get information about mouse button state changes.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.MouseDeviceImp.GetAxis(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves values for the X, Y and Wheel axes. No other axes are supported by this device.
member.param: The axis to retrieve information for.
member.returns: The value at the given axis.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.MouseDeviceImp.GetButton(System.Int32)
member.summary: This device does not support to-be-polled-buttons. All mouse buttons are event-driven. Listen to the event to receive keyboard notifications from this device.
member.param: No matter what you specify here, you'll evoke an exception.

member.name: T:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.TouchDeviceImp
member.summary: Touch input device implementation for the Web platforms. This implementation uses the HTML5 touch api which doesn't seem to provide a value how many simultaneous touchpoints are supported. Thus we assume 5.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.TouchDeviceImp.P2F(System.Object)
member.summary: Converts the value of a touch point to float.
member.param: The value of the point to convert.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.TouchDeviceImp.#ctor(WebAssembly.JSObject)
member.summary: Implements a touch device for windows.

member.name: P:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.TouchDeviceImp.Desc
member.summary: Short description string for this device to be used in dialogs.

member.name: P:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.TouchDeviceImp.Id
member.summary: Returns a (hopefully) unique ID for this driver. Uniqueness is granted by using the full class name (including namespace).

member.name: E:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.TouchDeviceImp.AxisValueChanged
member.summary: Occurs on value changes of axes exhibited by this device. Only applies for axes where the is set to false.

member.name: E:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.TouchDeviceImp.ButtonValueChanged
member.summary: A touchpoints's contact state is communicated by a button.

member.name: P:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.TouchDeviceImp.Category
member.summary: Returns , just because it's a touch device.

member.name: P:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.TouchDeviceImp.AxesCount
member.summary: Returns the number of axes. Up to five touchpoints (with two axes (X and Y) per touchpoint plus one axis carrying the number of currently touched touchpoints plus four axes describing the minimum and maximum X and Y values.

member.name: P:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.TouchDeviceImp.AxisImpDesc
member.summary: Returns description information for all axes.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.TouchDeviceImp.GetAxis(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves values for the number of currently active touchpoints and the touches min and max values. The touchpoint X and Y axes themselves are event-based axes. Do not query them here.
member.param: The axis to retrieve information for.
member.returns: The value at the given axis.

member.name: P:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.TouchDeviceImp.ButtonCount
member.summary: Retrieves the button count. One button for each of the up to five supported touchpoints signaling that the touchpoint currently has contact.

member.name: P:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.TouchDeviceImp.ButtonImpDesc
member.summary: Retrieve a description for each button.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.TouchDeviceImp.GetButton(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the button state. This device's buttons signal that a finger (nose, elbow, knee...) currently has contact with the scree surface.
member.returns: true if the button is hit, else false

member.summary: Gets the shader parameter. The Shader parameter is used to bind values inside of shader programs that run on the graphics card. Do not use this function in frequent updates as it transfers information from graphics card to the cpu which takes time.
member.returns: The Shader parameter is returned if the name is found, otherwise null.

member.name: P:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.RenderContextImp.ClearColor
member.summary: Gets and sets the color of the background.

member.name: P:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.RenderContextImp.ClearDepth
member.summary: Gets and sets the clear depth value which is used to clear the depth buffer.
member.value: Specifies the depth value used when the depth buffer is cleared. The initial value is 1. This value is clamped to the range [0,1].

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.RenderContextImp.Clear(Fusee.Engine.Common.ClearFlags)
member.summary: Clears the specified flags.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.RenderContextImp.Scissor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Only pixels that lie within the scissor box can be modified by drawing commands. Note that the Scissor test must be enabled for this to work.
member.param: X Coordinate of the lower left point of the scissor box.
Y Coordinate of the lower left point of the scissor box.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.RenderContextImp.EnableDepthClamp
member.summary: The clipping behavior against the Z position of a vertex can be turned off by activating depth clamping. This is done with glEnable(GL_DEPTH_CLAMP). This will cause the clip-space Z to remain unclipped by the front and rear viewing volume. See: https://www.khronos.org/opengl/wiki/Vertex_Post-Processing#Depth_clamping

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.RenderContextImp.DisableDepthClamp
member.summary: Disables depths clamping.

member.summary: Create one single multi-purpose attribute buffer

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.RenderContextImp.DeleteAttributeBuffer(Fusee.Engine.Common.IAttribImp)
member.summary: Remove an attribute buffer previously created with and release all associated resources allocated on the GPU.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.RenderContextImp.SetVertices(Fusee.Engine.Common.IMeshImp,Fusee.Math.Core.float3[])
member.summary: Binds the vertices onto the GL render context and assigns an VertexBuffer index to the passed instance.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.RenderContextImp.DetachTextureFromFbo(Fusee.Engine.Common.IRenderTarget,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Detaches a texture from the frame buffer object, associated with the given render target.
member.param: Number of the fbo attachment. For example: attachment = 1 will detach the texture currently associated with .
Determines if the texture is a depth texture. In this case the texture currently associated with will be detached.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.RenderContextImp.AttacheTextureToFbo(Fusee.Engine.Common.IRenderTarget,System.Boolean,Fusee.Engine.Common.ITextureHandle,System.Int32)
member.summary: Attaches a texture to the frame buffer object, associated with the given render target.
member.param: Number of the fbo attachment. For example: attachment = 1 will attach the texture to .
Determines if the texture is a depth texture. In this case the texture is attached to .
The gpu handle of the texture.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.RenderContextImp.Viewport(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the Viewport of the rendering output window by x,y position and width,height parameters. The Viewport is the portion of the final image window.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.Imp.Graphics.WebAsm.RenderContextImp.ColorMask(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable or disable Color channels to be written to the frame buffer (final image). Use this function as a color channel filter for the final image.
